subject_terms_3: Force 136 (Guerilla movement) 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Chin, Phui Kong, 1923- war personalities
physical_appearance: This is a form document. The title is printed at the top of the document, and is underlined. The form has several sections, each segmented by a horizontal printed line. It is printed in black ink. On the form, there are written inscriptions in a pencil. The document is slightly torn, especially along the top.
sgcool_label_text:
This pouch containing booklets, notes and a badge belongs to part of a collection of artefacts owned by Chan Phui Kong who was involved in the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. Chanâ€™s collection forms part of a larger collection of materials gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was also a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

The notes contain information on the nature of explosives and how to proceed with a guerrilla mission.
title_text: Chan Phui Kong Collection: Pouch containing Booklets, a Badge and Notes Chan Phui Kong Collection: Military reconnaissance survey form
